title: Matt Smith is worried about climate change but won't stop flying
text:
Matt Smith says he should be ‘doing more’ to help climate change (Photo by Santiago Felipe/Getty Images)

Matt Smith has shared how he’s worried about climate change and feels like he should be doing more to help, but won’t be giving up flying anytime soon.

The actor spoke about how he knows he could be doing more about the issue but it’s ‘tough’ and we ‘need more ingenuity’ to solve the problem.

Speaking to Sunday Times Culture magazine, Matt said: ‘The idea that Greenland is melting freaks me out. Yet am I an active campaigner? Do I do enough? No…

‘I’m not saying, “It doesn’t exist, guys.” But I could do more. I eat meat. Not loads, but I like a roast. And I drive a car. I don’t not get on planes….

‘This is what I mean about bigger thinking, for all of us. We just need more ingenuity. But the plane thing is tough. I won’t not fly, because I’ve got to get where I’m going.’

Matt Smith and Lily James have been dating since 2014 (Photo by David M. Benett/Dave Benett/Getty Images for Burberry)

The 36-year-old also added that having children of his own would make him think about the issue more.

‘Basically, my climate-change anxiety is really random. I’ll go, “Oh man, polar bears. F**king polar bears!” I’ll wig out about them not having ice to get back on.

‘I don’t have children yet, but having them would make me think about it a lot more.’

The former Doctor Who actor – who is currently in a relationship with actress Lily James – admitted his friends and family are central to his existence and, although he likes to ‘take risks’ and have fun, he ultimately thinks the purpose of life is to ‘procreate’.
